alert.note: Alert for Eastern, Central El Paso County (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued March 31 at 5:37AM CDT until March 31 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM MDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Southwest winds 35 to 45 mph with gusts over 50. Some gusts up to 60 mph possible over higher elevations and east slopes of terrain overnight. * WHERE...Portions of south-central and southwestern New Mexico and far west Texas. This includes the Black Range and highlands of the Gila region. In addition. lowland locations and slopes east of the San Andres, Organ, and Franklin mountain ridges. * WHEN...Overnight through 6 AM MDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds will blow down trees and power lines. Widespread power outages are expected. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles.
info.instruction: People should avoid being outside in forested areas and around trees and branches. If possible, remain in the lower levels of your home during the windstorm, and avoid windows. Use caution if you must drive.
